title: Swiss yodelling added to UNESCO cultural heritage list | The World | ABC NEWS
description: The Swiss tradition of yodelling has been inscribed on UNESCO's Intangible Cultural Heritage List. The singing style's roots have been traced to the Central Alps, where herders once used the echoing calls to send messages across valleys and summon their flocks. Professor of Yodelling Nadja Räss spoke to ABC News.  Subscribe: http://ab.co/1svxLVE  ABC NEWS provides around the clock coverage of news events as they break in Australia and abroad. It's news when you want it, from Australia's most trusted news organisation. title: NATO chief warns its members could be Russia's 'next target' | ABC NEWS
description: NATO Chief Mark Rutte has urged European nations to prepare for war “like our grandparents endured” during a speech in Berlin. He says countries weren’t taking the threat of Russia seriously. Meanwhile, Moscow has claimed it has taken full control of Siversk, a town in eastern Ukraine. title: Will the Netflix-Warner Bros deal kill the movies? | ABC News Daily podcast
description: Streaming giant Netflix is battling Paramount for control of the historic Warner Bros studio, which includes HBO and a treasure trove of film and TV content.   Warner Bros has backed the $72 billion US Netflix bid, despite Paramount offering billions more in a deal that would include the television assets, including news network CNN and the Discovery channel.    Today, Chris Bumbray, editor-in-chief of entertainment news website JoBlo.com on what it means for how we watch shows and movies and whether this moment marks the end of cinema as we know it.    Featured:    Chris Bumbray, editor-in-chief JoBlo.com

title: Extreme heat and fire danger across the weekend for southwestern WA | ABC NEWS
description: The Bureau of Meteorology has forecast heatwave warnings and extreme fire conditions across large parts of Australia over the weekend.  00:00 – High to extreme fire danger is predicted for much of southwestern Western Australia, particularly to the north and east of Perth. 02:27 – Heat wave conditions are forecast for South Australia, with storms possible, which could ignite fires. 02:49 – The Northern Territory will experience low to severe heat wave conditions. 03:07 – There are advice-level fires burning in Tasmania, especially in the east, ahead of a cold front that brings concerning strong winds. 03:53 – The east coast is under a thunderstorm warning, with a risk of flash flooding and subsequent fire warnings. title: US sanctions Maduro's nephews and ships after seizure of oil tanker | ABC NEWS
description: The White House says it will keep all the oil from the tanker seized off the coast of Venezuela as the US imposes further sanctions on family members of President Nicolas Maduro and six Venezuelan ships. Karoline Leavitt says the captured ship will be taken to a US port, as Caracas accuses the Trump administration of piracy. title: 20 years since the Cronulla riots | ABC NEWS
description: It is the 20th anniversary of the violent Cronulla riots south of Sydney, which saw more than 100 people arrested as racial tensions boiled over. Former Sydney Morning Herald photojournalist Andrew Meares remembers the feeling turning from celebratory to "menacing". title: Firefighters reopen access to Tasmanian coastal communities threatened by fires | ABC NEWS
description: Firefighters have reopened the road to residents of a bushfire-struck community on Tasmania's east coast, as the fire between Dianas Basin and Stieglitz is brought under control.  The blaze has been contained, and fire crews and emergency services are working to consolidate the fireground. title: Tom Silvagni revealed as man from high-profile Victorian family convicted of rape | ABC NEWS
description: Tom Silvagni, 23, has been revealed as the man from a high-profile family found guilty of raping a woman last year. His identity can now be revealed following the lifting of a suppression order on his name. Tom Silvagni is due to face court again tomorrow for a pre-sentence hearing.  If this story raises issues for you: 1800 Respect National Helpline: 1800 737 732 Men's Referral Service: 1300 766 491 Lifeline (24-hour crisis line): 131 114 Victims of Crime Helpline: 1800 819 817 Full Stop Australia: 1800 385 578  Video by Andi Yu via ABC News Victoria. title: Reddit files legal challenge against Australia’s social media ban for under-16s | ABC NEWS
description: Reddit has filed a High Court challenge against Australia's social media ban for children under 16. The US web platform is currently complying with the legislation but claims the new restrictions are being applied to the company incorrectly. title: When and where to watch the Geminids, Australia's most active meteor shower | ABC NEWS
description: The Geminid meteor shower will be visible this weekend, with the potential to see dozens of meteors per hour as Earth traverses the debris of asteroid 3200 Phaethon. Astrophysicist Professor Lisa Harvey-Smith from the University of New South Wales advises looking north for the best view of the meteors, as a thin crescent Moon will create an ideal dark sky. title: Reddit challenges social media ban for under-16s | ABC NEWS
description: Reddit has filed a High Court challenge alleging that Australia's social media restrictions are being applied to the company inaccurately. The company is currently complying with the legislation but has said the new law "has the unfortunate effect of forcing intrusive and potentially insecure verification processes on adults as well as minors".
